ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This was an interesting course to take. It involves a lot of readings on health intervention efforts on donor and country levels with a particular focus on fiscal analysis, creation of fiscal space, and using cost effectiveness analysis and modeling to select amongst different courses of action. It' strengths were an experienced professor. It could have benefited from more tutorials and hands on experience with modeling software.

I would absolutely recommend this class. It is a great combination of modeling and what is possible to be implemented in the real world. It is definitely a class that is relevant for more people than just those interested in global health.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course provides a helpful look at the donor community and their efforts as well as country efforts. It applies concepts of cost effectiveness analysis, projection of outcomes and fiscal analysis. It was a worthwhile course to take.
Yes this class was directly applicable to my program and goals after school. Pr. Hecht does a great job of teaching a class that is on the cutting edge of the discipline.
